Demand that Albuquerque City Councilors pass Resolution 18-7.
  

Don't let Albuquerque City Councilors divide families

Contact Albuquerque City Councilors to support Resolution 18-7 and help strengthen Albuquerque as an immigrant-friendly community.
TAKE ACTION
   Share this:                  

If you forward, the links will open to a page with your personal information.

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Our community has been fighting against Trump's immigration policies that have created a machine of human misery for immigrant communities since he took office. On Monday, April 16 at 5 p.m., the Albuquerque City Council will consider Resolution 18-7, which would allow Albuquerque to continue our fight against Trump's deportation agenda and ensure that we are not complicit in the enforcement of federal deportation programs.

Email Albuquerque City Councilors to let them know you support Resolution 18-7.

In Albuquerque, we have fought back locally for over a decade against federal deportation programs that fuel racial profiling, trample on our civil rights, and lead to devastating family separation. We will not let Trump and Sessions bully our local governments into cooperating with their draconian detention and deportation agenda.

With your support, the City of Albuquerque will continue to be a place that welcomes all people. Thank you for reaffirming the dignity of all Albuquerque residents.

Help strengthen Albuquerque as an immigrant-friendly community by emailing Albuquerque City Councilors.

In solidarity,

Ana Moran
Field Organizer
ACLU of New Mexico
